creator: scoggins@sparta.com
text:
FOP seems to have a problem rendering some of my images which are in JPEG 
format to a PDF file.  The problem is that large areas of white pixels in the 
image get turned into random colors.  The rest of the image looks fine.  When I 
converted the JPEG image to a GIF image, everything worked fine.

creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
text:
FOP does not even try to decompress the bitmap. Turning white pixels into
random color appears to be a symptom of a mangled color mapping. Therefore
the most likely reason for the problematic behaviour seems to be an
unsupported palette format or an invalid or mangled JPEG header.
There isn't much more to analyze without one of the images at hand.
batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
creator: gadams@apache.org
